text: let's just say you want to be President
of the United States in 2016 what
characteristics will give you the best
chance
well the Pew Research Center got some
good insight recently when I asked what
traits Americans wanted in a president
topping the list military service 43% of
Americans said they're more likely to
support a veteran for president you can
even see this historically since 31 out
of 44 presidents have done some kind of
military service now in recent years
most presidents have gone to prestigious
universities but it wasn't always like
that Harry Truman never graduated
college and that wasn't too long ago he
actually joins twelve other presidents
with no college degree including Abraham
Lincoln and do Americans really care
almost three-quarters said it didn't
matter if a president or presidential
candidate goes to a top-tier university
now on the campaign trail candidates
love-love-love to talk about how their
Washington outsiders
early in the 2008 campaign a candidate's
Washington experience made 35% of people
more likely to vote for them now check
out how those numbers have flipped yep
stay out of Washington if you can now
Barack Obama made history becoming the
first black president so how open our
Americans to further barrier-breaking
a woman president 71% said it wouldn't
matter if a candidate was female a gay
or lesbian president 66% said this
wouldn't matter either an atheist well
that's a deal-breaker if you don't
believe in God then more than half of
America is less likely to send you to
the Oval Office
David Botti BBC News Washington
